attributes.action: Clamp any vehicle parked in disabled bays without a blue badge
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: warning signs should be erected in ALL car parks which provide disabled bays stating that anyone who parks here and does not display a valid blue badge will be clamped. This policy was tested in Leeds and the number of abuses of the bays declined rapidly.  With the advent of disability access laws, is the Government not guilty of breaching them if they do not act to enforce blue badge and disabled bay parking abuse as in effect they are condoning the denying of access to disabled people?
